meanings.definition: Waddying: the act of using a waddy as a weapon
meanings.sent1: During the fight, he defended himself by waddying with his trusty waddy.
meanings.sent2: The waddying of the criminal left a mark on the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The waddying contest at the fair was quite intense.
meanings.sent4: Her waddying in the game of tag made her the ultimate champion.
meanings.sent5: The sound of waddying echoed through the forest, scaring away the animals.

meanings.definition: Waddying: to strike or beat with a waddy
meanings.sent1: She waddying the drum to create a rhythmic beat.
meanings.sent2: The lumberjack was waddying the tree to chop it down.
meanings.sent3: He waddying the table to get rid of the crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The waves waddying against the shore sounded like a soothing melody.
meanings.sent5: The blacksmith was waddying the metal to shape it into a sword.

meanings.definition: Waddying: a person who uses a waddy as a weapon
meanings.sent1: The skilled waddying was respected by all in the village.
meanings.sent2: The waddying stood guard at the entrance, ready to defend.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous waddying played pranks with his waddy.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the fastest waddying in the west.
meanings.sent5: The legendary waddying was feared by all who crossed his path.
